title: Foundation of Law & Identity
summary: Level 1 introduces the living law of the land, natural rights, and the importance of understanding your lawful identity as a man or woman under public law. These foundational truths prepare you to recognize the difference between lawful self-governance and corporate control.

questions.question: What are the two foundational principles of all true law according to TSAA teachings?
Under natural law, who is the ultimate authority over a living man or woman?
options: Their own conscience guided by divine law
A judge of the high court

questions.question: What is meant by 'living law'?
options: Law that arises from life itself and respects free will

questions.question: In lawful self-governance, what does 'sovereignty' truly mean?
options: Personal responsibility and self-governance under natural law
Being free from all moral obligations

questions.question: According to TSAA, what was lost when people accepted corporate 'citizenship'?
options: Their lawful standing as living men and women on the land
The ability to hold a driver’s licence

questions.question: What is the difference between lawful and legal?
options: Lawful refers to natural and public law; legal refers to corporate rules
They mean exactly the same thing
Legal applies only to religious institutions

questions.question: What defines a 'person' in corporate or maritime law?
options: A legal fiction or corporate construct
A natural soul recognized by God

questions.question: Why is understanding the difference between a living being and a legal person essential?
options: Because the legal person is subject to corporate law while the living being is not
Because it changes the way taxes are paid

questions.question: What is the lawful foundation of all self-governing assemblies?
options: Peace, good faith, and mutual respect

questions.question: What is a Public Law Assembly?
options: An unincorporated group of living men and women keeping the peace and administering the land
A commercial company formed under the Companies Act

questions.question: Why must lawful documents be signed with an autograph instead of a signature?
options: An autograph represents the living being; a signature represents a corporate agent

questions.question: What does TSAA mean by 'returning to the land and soil jurisdiction'?
options: Reclaiming one’s lawful standing as a living man or woman under natural law

questions.question: Which law form governs the sea or commerce?
Which law form governs living people on the land?
What is the ultimate purpose of lawful government?
options: To serve and protect the people’s rights and property
To collect taxes for foreign powers

questions.question: In lawful terms, what does the word 'state' originally refer to?
options: The condition or status of being — not a corporate territory

questions.question: What principle separates the living jurisdiction from the legal jurisdiction?
According to TSAA, why are people called 'citizens' in corporate systems?
options: Because they are considered property or employees of the corporation
Because it reflects ancient tribal membership

questions.question: How does a man or woman reclaim their lawful estate?
options: By recording their status correction and reconveyance to the land and soil jurisdiction
By paying all debts to the state

questions.question: What does it mean to 'record, not register'?
options: Recording places ownership on the public record; registration surrenders it to another authority

questions.question: Why do lawful assemblies avoid political affiliations?
options: Because politics divides the people and lawful assemblies operate in peace and unity
Because it is illegal to vote

questions.question: How is 'common law' distinguished from 'statutory law'?
options: Common law is based on customs and moral principles; statutory law is written by legislatures
Common law only applies in courts of record
They are the same in modern use

questions.question: What document acts as living proof of your lawful intent to self-govern?
What is the purpose of the Public Law Assembly’s Coordinators?
options: To assist others in correcting their status and keeping the peace

questions.question: Which phrase best summarizes lawful living?
options: Do no harm, cause no loss, keep the peace
